alert.note: Alert for Lawrence; Wabash (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 30 at 9:32PM CST until February 09 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Indiana... Illinois... Wabash River from Lafayette to Vincennes. .Lowland flooding continues along the Wabash River from Lafayette to Riverton, and will arrive at Vincennes Wednesday morning. The crest is currently near Clinton. Flooding is expected to continue along the lower Wabash at Riverton and Vincennes well into next week. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON TO FRIDAY, FEBRUARY 09... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Vincennes. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon to Friday, February 09. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Agricultural lands and some oil fields flood. Several township roads about 1.25 miles south of St. Francesville and River Road between Billett Road and Lincoln Memorial Bridge in Lawrence County are flooded. Extensive flooding of Kimmell Park at Vincennes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM EST Tuesday /8:45 PM CST Tuesday/ the stage was 15.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 18.4 feet Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Friday, February 09. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Wednesday afternoon by around 145 PM EST /1245 PM CST/.
